An assistive technology to support keyboard only users in navigating web content based on the landmark regions and heading structure of the page.
Shortcut key (Alt+2 or Option+2) to open menu.
Organized list of landmark regions on a page.
Filtered view of top level heading structure.
Selection from the menu moves keyboard focus to the associated landmark or headings.

li.a: SkipTo Landmarks & Headings — Chrome Web Store

contents.p: SkipTo Landmarks & Headings is open source software. The code is available at https://github.com/skipto/extension.

ul.li: A tool for designers, developers and accessibility testers to easily identify and view the headings and landmarks region structure of a web page.
List of all landmark regions in document order, each menu item includes landmark roles and accessible name.
List of all headings in document order, each menu item includes the heading level and accessible name.
Highlights selected landmark region or heading on the page.
Does not move keyboard focus to the selected landmark region of heading.

contents.p: Page Structure for Firefox is open source software. The code is available at https://github.com/a11y-tools/page-structure.

ul.li: Improved reliability and responsiveness to page updates and tab changes.
Support for ARIA 1.2 requirements.
Support for ARIA in HTML requirements.
Export evaluation results as CVS or JSON format.
Element details view includes more information about each element.
Removed "HTML4 Legacy Techniques" rule set, only "HTML and ARIA Techniques" ruleset.

contents.p: Page Structure for Firefox is open source software. The code is available at https://github.com/a11y-tools/page-structure.

ul.li: Total rewrite of evaluation library and rules to use modern JS techniques.
Review and fix rules and test cases for support of ARIA 1.2, ARIA in HTML and WCAG 2.1 requirements.

New feature to allow evaluation to be limited to subsets of rules:
8-10 "First Step" rules (mixture of WCAG Level A and AA rules).
First Step and all WCAG Level A rules.
All WCAG Level A and AA rules, which includes all first step rules.
Will be first released in AInspector for Firefox 2.1
